intro: Calandrinia congdonii, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of showy pink to purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its fleshy leaves and deep root system help it conserve water and survive in harsh desert conditions.
